SENT.plain: Cardiac myxoma is the most common primary tumor of the heart
The tumor is located mainly in the left atrium but can arise from any heart chamber
Clinical symptoms are variable but dyspnea and embolism are the most frequent
We report a case of a young man that had embolic ischemic stroke caused by a large left ventricular myxoma
The patient underwent surgery three weeks after the stroke
The tumor was carefully resected without fragmentation
We emphasize the rarity of this location together with a review of the current literature
